result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Scheduling Order. Signed by RMW 8/31/22.  gll
Jury trial on December 21, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Final pre-trial on December 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:48 AM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel. Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court w/Daniel Michael Wiersig, in custody. Court notes Motion to Suppress and Ex#1; summarizes facts and finds that there was reasonable suspicion to warrant detention, as to certification of the K-9, court finds probable cause to search based on the K9's alert and that certification of K9 Badger is proper. Based on the courts findings, DE's Motion to Suppress is denied. Atty Harrelson notes there is not an accepted offer and asks to set for trial. Attys will work with JA and Analyst to coordinate dates. Atty Harrelson states DE would like to be moved in the prison system as he is serving a prison sentence at this time, asks for a signature bond. Atty Ballo does not object to DE being transferred back to prison, does not feel the cash needs to be forfeited. Atty Harrelson responds. Once trial is set, bond may be addressed again. Prison and Jail may have to sort out DE's custody rather than the court. Atty Harrelson to research further. Adjourned:  9:02 am.

10:05 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Defendant Daniel Michael Wiersig in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Daniel Michael Wiersig.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Motion to suppress. Court grants Atty Harrelson motion for sequestration. S/T Deputy M. Grothe. Direct by ADA Ballo. Exhibit #2 - Narratives; not offered. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Atty Harrelson plays DVD marked as Exhibit #1 - DVD, folder Grothe and from folder Kaiser; O/R. Redirect by ADA Ballo. 11:05 am S/T Officer L. Radke. Direct by ADA Ballo. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Attorney arguments. Court to review the video and give an oral decision.
Oral ruling scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Oral ruling on August 31, 2022 at 08:45 am.

8:53 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Daniel Michael Wiersig in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Daniel Michael Wiersig. Bond arguments. Atty Harrelson requests zoom appearances on behalf of Def. however Atty Harrelson requests def to appear in person for the motion hearing.  Def to be incarcerated approximately 4 years. Court sets motion hearing at this time and will address bond, etc at the next hearing. 
Motion hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

04:18 PM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel.   ADA:   Bela Alexander Ballo   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Daniel Michael Wiersig appeared from jail. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Atty Harrelson has received discovery. Atty Ballo notes no offer has been sent yet. Adjourned:  4:21 pm  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Settlement conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Arraignment on May 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:43 AM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel   ADA:   Bela Alexander Ballo   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Daniel Michael Wiersig appeared from jail.  S/T Deputy Garrett Kiser; SCSO; direct by Atty Ballo. Record reflects identity of the DE. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Redirect by Atty Ballo. Bindover arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Bond continues in form and amount. Adjourned: 10:19 am.  Arraignment scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Pretrial Assessment Report. hml
Preliminary hearing on May 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

2:23 PM  Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, REP: Deiss, Clk: K. Anderson, ADA: Bela Alexander Ballo, DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson for today, DF:  Daniel Michael Wiersig appeared from jail by video means. DE qualifies for public defender. Atty. Harrelson states that DE is on PO hold. Atty. Harrelson states that he believes he will be taking this case. Prelim time limits waived. Court finds good cause to extend time limits. Court sets PH. Waives reading. ADA Ballo requests bond. Atty. Harrelson makes bond argument. Court sets bond. Adjourned: 2:35 PM. kma  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
